text: Ivy Bottini (August 15, 1926 – February 25, 2021) was an American activist. She supported women's rights and LGBT rights. She also was a visual artist. She was born in New York City. In 1966, she helped found the New York chapter of the National Organization for Women. Her memoir, The Liberation of Ivy Bottini: A Memoir of Love and Activism, as told to Judith V. Branzburg, was published by Bedazzled Ink Publishing Company in November, 2018. Bottini died in Florida on February 25, 2021 at the age of 94.RIP Ivy Bottini – WeHo Icon and LGBT Advocate Dies Peacefully Surrounded by Family ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American LGBT rights activists Category:American feminists Category:Lesbian feminists Category:LGBT artists Category:American LGBT writers Category:American autobiographers Category:Artists from New York City Category:Writers from New York City Category:LGBT people from New York City
title: Ivy Bottini
